Comment: >So far, Congress has only passed six bills—five of which have been signed into law—the fewest of any president in the first 100 days of an administration in the last seven decades, according to a TIME analysis of congressional records.  Notable considering the same party majorities in the House and Senate aligned with the Republican president (and an ideologically aligned 6-3 majority Supreme Court that would show acquiescence to their allies on legislation constitutionality).   If they wanted to pass meaningful immigration legislation, researched and debated tariff changes, government spending overhauls, and other things important to Americans and their base, they could do so, with relative ease due to single party alignment throughout the federal government. They are not.
